channel.title: Makeing & useing your own BootScreens (Xp)
channel.description:
Just incase theres some people out there who don't know what I'm talking about, I'm talking about the screen that comes up when you start the computer...kinda looks like this
[IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/NewBitmapImage.jpg[/img]
Anyway, it gets kinda boreing of see the same screen over and over when you turn on the comp, why use the default when you can use something creative, or something funny like this:
[IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/piratededition01.jpg[/img]
I also did something different, instead of putting the entire tutorial here, I made a batch file that takes you through what you need to do, to make a bootscreen, it will even take you to the download page to get the program I used to change my bootscreen, incase you want to download and install it ahead of time heres the link : http://www.stardock.com/products/bootskin/downloads.asp
So attached to this post is my Tutorial, when you go through it the first time please READ everything, yes I know thats asking a lot for some of our members :rolleyes: but it'll only take you 5 mins and really all you have to do is read it once and you'll know how to do everything.The batch file litteraly does everything that I deemed "complicated" all you have to do is supply the picture and/or a loading bar picture
Along with my TuT I included the picture above and some loadingbar pictures in various colors so I gave you everything you need to make your first screen (except the BootSkin program, link above)
Credits to: Swissboy for making the "pirated edition" screen and the loadingbar images Stardock for the BootSkin program
If somehow you have any problems or questons, post them!
Screens:
Not that great but I'm trying to get used to 16-bit colors.. http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/linuxboot.jpg
Firefox! :P http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/ffbootscreen3.jpg http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/ffbootscreen.jpg

item.title: Makeing & useing your own BootScreens (Xp)
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

[quote=“rob1601, post:12, topic:116744”]Yes it does cause lag,

Why you ask?

Basically because it is as you start your virtual memory. It’s a process

Why use it then?

Show off infront of your friends[/quote]

  1. Why use it?
    Easy because its loading a picture when you turn on the comp, that is it, no other processes are running while your comp is idle, THERE IS NO BootSkin.exe in the process tray. It only runs when you start the comp, and for what…5 seconds?

Jeez would you people lay off already, and I’m not “showing off” I’m posting a tutorial about changeing your bootscreen, thats what this section is for-tutorials

Also if people would stop attacking my thread then I wouldn’t have to defend it like this and then I wouldn’t be “showing off” as you claim -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Makeing & useing your own BootScreens (Xp)
item.dc:creator: @rob1601 rob1601
item.description:
@rob1601 wrote:

Yes it does cause lag,

Why you ask?

Basically because it is as you start your virtual memory. It’s a process

Why use it then?

Show off infront of your friends

Read full topic

item.title: Makeing & useing your own BootScreens (Xp)
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

I would say it is, because you can always switch back to the default bootscreen, really all my TuT batch thing does is:

Makes a folder with a config file, useing settings you enter, such as the BootSkin’s title, Author name etc.
Then you put your bootscreen pic in the folder it made
Then it moves that folder to BootSkin’s root folder

The BootSkin program does everything else, all the batch file does is make the Skin file for it to use.

…I don’t know if I answered your queston but I tried…? :o

Read full topic

item.title: Makeing & useing your own BootScreens (Xp)
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

therealjdb:

Lol, You’re welcome, I’m a bit busy right now but I’ll post a screen shot later of the one i made XD

Alright thanks, maybe if people see more pics, more people will download and try it :D…up to 4 now…hey it only took 3 days for it to catch on :rolleyes: lol

I’m working on a pretty funny one right now…yes trying to make my own pic from scratch…sorta (watch out lol)

I’ll put any good ones I make on the first post as links.

Read full topic

item.title: Makeing & useing your own BootScreens (Xp)
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

downloaded 1 times(s) wahoo!

Well I’m glad theres at least one person who wants to try this. Thanks for the backup therealjob If you try this please post back on your thoughts. Maybe post a screenshot of your bootscreen…?

Heres one I just made for the heck of it. I wanted to make a Firefox bootscreen so I searched google for a good pic, but the pic was too big and too colorful to start out with, so when I but it in bitmap format it kinda lost some of its quality.

http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/ffbootscreen.jpg

I’m going to try and find a different pic, see what happens…

:EDIT
Found a less colorful pic, so bitmap was, more forgiving on this one Only problem with this one is the preview pic is kinda small so you can’t see the words that great, but if the comp was really booting up and the pic was full screen you would see them better. Anyways they say “Time for the hunted to be the hunter” lol

ffbootscreen3.jpg643×505

Read full topic

item.title: Makeing & useing your own BootScreens (Xp)
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

[quote=“Try Me, post:2, topic:116744”]I Would highly reccommend staying the fuck away from stardock’s products…
Most of it cause very, very high lagg to lower RAM HD’s.

Just my thoughts =p[/quote]

How is changeing your bootscreen going to result major lag on your comp? Have you at least tried it? I won’t disagree with your first statement, I don’t use windowblinds, cursorXP, etc etc. This is the only stardock product I use and my comp does not have “very, very high lagg”

Before you make a comment like that at least try the product, THEN if you computer lags post that.

Read full topic

Just incase theres some people out there who don’t know what I’m talking about, I’m talking about the screen that comes up when you start the computer…kinda looks like this

Anyway, it gets kinda boreing of see the same screen over and over when you turn on the comp, why use the default when you can use something creative, or something funny like this:

I also did something different, instead of putting the entire tutorial here, I made a batch file that takes you through what you need to do, to make a bootscreen, it will even take you to the download page to get the program I used to change my bootscreen, incase you want to download and install it ahead of time heres the link : http://www.stardock.com/products/bootskin/downloads.asp
